results.title: Tibetan traders
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the way of life, beliefs and the epic journey of semi-nomadic traders dwelling in one of the strategic mountain passes between south-western Tibet and India in the Himalayas.
results.description: Shows the way of life, beliefs and the epic journey of semi-nomadic traders dwelling in one of the strategic mountain passes between south-western Tibet and India in the Himalayas.

results.title: Tibetan book of the dead. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Hiroaki Mori, Yukari Hayashi, Atsunori Kawamura, David Verrall, Mistral Film, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This two-part series explores ancient teachings on death and dying. It was filmed over a four-month period on location in the Himalayas where the original text still yields an essential influence over people’s views of life and death. Narrated by Leonard Cohen, Part 2: “The Great liberation”, is a docu-drama which, in the company of a Buddhist lama and a 13-year-old novice monk, leads us into the very foundations of Buddhist philosophy - the search for compassion and truth. Pema Choden, the monk and Tubten, the young novice read from the texts of the ‘Tibetan Book of the Dead’ as they conduct the 49 days of final rites for a deceased Himalayan villager. We must all face the death of somebody we love, as well as our own death. This film helps us prepare for these inevitabilities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barrie Angus McLean, Hiroaki Mori, Yukari Hayashi, Atsunori Kawamura, David Verrall, Mistral Film, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and ONF | NFB

results.title: Tibetan book of the dead. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Yukari Hayashi, Atsunori Kawamura, David Verrall, Mistral Film, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This two-part series explores ancient teachings on death and dying. It was filmed over a four-month period on location in the Himalayas where the original text still yields an essential influence over people’s views of life and death. Narrated by Leonard Cohen, Part 1: “A Way of life” is a path-breaking documentary containing remarkable footage of the rites and liturgies surrounding and following the death of a Ladakhi elder. The Dalai Lama explains his own feelings about death, while other scenes within a palliative care hospice in San Francisco depict the use of the texts to counsel dying patients. This film, by revealing ancient teachings on how to think about death and dying, can be a valuable source of counsel and comfort.

results.title: Tibet: the lost mystery
results.brief_description: The first of a two part documentary that examines the mysterious story of Tibet. It is the story of a country unseen by Europeans until early this century, of its destruction by invading Chinese in 1950 and the flight into India of the Dalai Lama with 100,000 Tibetans.

results.title: Tibet: a personal report
results.creator_credit: Anne Greene, Elena Greene and Felix Greene
results.brief_description: Records the conditions of life in precommunist Tibet as well as the fascinating life and activities of the people today. Shows not only the towns but the vast wind swept grasslands, 16,000 feet above sea level, where many Tibetans still live as nomads.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Greene, Elena Greene and Felix Greene

results.title: Ti-Jean in the land of iron
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Leonard Forest and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: No challenge, no obstacle is too great for ten-year-old Ti-Jean. As in his other exploits, he proves equal to every situation. Working his boat passage, flying an aircraft, saving a mine from disaster—all are in a day’s work for him before he again mounts his white horse and rides off in search of new adventures.

results.title: Ti-Jean goes west
results.brief_description: The Canadian prairies, seen through the eyes of a ten-year-old boy. Ti-Jean reaches the Golden West and hires out as a harvest hand. he learns to handle the equipment; he learns about the life of prairie farmers and, when a storm threatens, he works with the strength of ten to save a farmer’s crop.

results.title: Ti-Jean goes lumbering [B&W]
results.brief_description: A French-Canadian folk tale about the fantastic exploits of a mysterious little boy who one day rides into a winter logging camp on a big white horse. Ti-Jean’s feats dwarf those of even the hardiest lumberjack as he fells timber, cuts, carries and piles heavy logs and comes out the victor in every contest. The film portrays typical life and work in a Canadian logging camp.

results.title: Thus spake Richard Strauss
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and CBS Telelvision Network
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein narrates and conducts a performance of Richard Strauss’s “Thus spake Zarathustra”, a tone poem, based on the work by the German philosopher, Friedrich Nietzsche. Bernstein discusses the eight sections of the tone poem and shows how their philosophical content is expressed by the musical structure. Features the New York Philharmonic orchestra.
